In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, you can define a function `clean_column` that performs the specified transformations on a column name. Below is an example of how you might write this function:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    # Lowercase the string
    col = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespace
    col = strip(col)
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    col = replace(col, " " => "_")
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_")
    
    return col
end
```

This function takes a `String` as input and returns the cleaned version of the column name. It first lowers the case of the string, then strips any leading or trailing whitespace, and finally replaces spaces and hyphens with underscores.

You can use this function to clean column names in a dataframe or anywhere else you need to normalize text.
